001package ca.gc.cra.radar.application.util;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessageEvent;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessagePair;
005import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessageType;
006import java.util.Optional;
007
008/**
009 * FIFO-based pairing helper that matches request and response message events.
010 * <p>Not thread-safe; intended for per-flow use.</p>
011 *
012 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
013 */
014public class MessagePairer extends AbstractMessageSession {
015  /**
016   * Accepts a message event and returns a {@link MessagePair} when a matching counterpart arrives.
017   *
018   * @param event message event to consider
019   * @param isRequest {@code true} when the event should be buffered as a request
020   * @return completed pair when a buffered request and new response align; otherwise empty
021   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
022   */
023  public Optional<MessagePair> accept(MessageEvent event, boolean isRequest) {
024    if (event == null) return Optional.empty();
025    if (isRequest) {
026      enqueue(event);
027      return Optional.empty();
028    }
029    Optional<MessageEvent> maybeRequest = dequeue();
030    return maybeRequest.map(req -> new MessagePair(req, event));
031  }
032
033  /**
034   * Flushes pending state when a response is expected but missing.
035   *
036   * @param type message type to flush; only {@link MessageType#RESPONSE} triggers output
037   * @return synthetic pair containing the unmatched request when flushed; otherwise empty
038   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
039   */
040  public Optional<MessagePair> flush(MessageType type) {
041    if (type == MessageType.RESPONSE) {
042      Optional<MessageEvent> maybeRequest = dequeue();
043      return maybeRequest.map(req -> new MessagePair(req, null));
044    }
045    return Optional.empty();
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Clears buffered state.
050   *
051   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
052   */
053  public void close() {
054    while (hasPending()) {
055      dequeue();
056    }
057  }
058}
